Trial_Design.evidence: 2544 subjects with ≥70% asymptomatic carotid stenosis who were randomized to CAS or CEA

Participants.evidence: asymptomatic patients less than 80 years old (upper age eligibility)

Intervention.evidence: randomized to CAS or CEA in addition to standard medical therapy

Objective.evidence: To compare outcomes in asymptomatic, non-octogenarian patients treated with CAS versus CEA.

Method_Outcome.evidence: primary composite endpoint was any stroke, myocardial infarction, or death during the periprocedural period or ipsilateral stroke within 4 years after randomization

Blinding.evidence: Independent neurologic assessment and routine cardiac enzyme screening were performed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: One trial enrolled 1091 (548 CAS, 543 CEA) and another enrolled 1453 (1089 CAS, 364 CEA)

Result_Outcome.evidence: no significant difference in the primary endpoint between CAS and CEA (5.3% and 5.1%, hazard ratio (HR) = 1.02; 95% confidence interval (CI) 0.7–1.5; P=.91)

Harms.evidence: Periprocedural rates for the components are (CAS vs CEA): any stroke (2.7% vs. 1.5%, P=.07), myocardial infarction (0.6% vs. 1.7%, P=.01), death (0.1% vs 0.2%, P=.62), and any stroke or death (2.7% vs 1.6%, P=.07)
